text:
Ott/o
December 6t 1966
Mr. Ben F. Waple
Secretary,
Federal Communications Commission
Washington, D. C. 20554
Dear Mr. Waple:
Replying to the FCC Notice of Inquiry, B, FCC66-1007,90260,
Docket No. 14185, concerning Revision of FM Broadcast Rules,
particularly as to Allocation and Technical Standards (Educational
FM Channels), Station WGUC, property of the University of
Cincinnati, makes the following recommendation with special ref¬
erence to Section 4:
That Class B channels be permitted higher than
500-feet antenna height, with corresponding power
reduction, so that the net result would be equiva¬
lent to 50 KW E.R.P. at 500 feet.
That 50 KW at 500 feet should be a maximum with
less than this amount permitted, but no less than
twice the Class A figure of 5 KW E.R.P. at 500 feet.
In accordance with the Commission1s rules, 14 copies of this
comment are enclosed herewith.
Sincerely,
Joseph W. Sagmaster
Director of Broadcasting
University of Cincinnat:
cc: _'old Sandler, Executive Director
National Educational Radio
1346 Connecticut Ave., N.W.
Washington, D.C. 20036
JWS:
